metadata.title: Children and youth hospitalized for mental disorders, by urban versus rural/remote residence, Canada, 2018–2019 to 2023–2024
metadata.description: Hospitalizations for mental disorders among children and youth aged 5-24, stratified by place of residence
metadata.source: CIHI - Canadian Institute for Health Information

notes.rate_definition: Rate: Crude rate per 100,000 children and youth age 5 to 24
notes.classification: Urban versus rural/remote area was assigned based on the patient's residential postal code and Statistics Canada's Statistical Area Classification type (SACtype): SACtypes 1, 2 and 3 are urban, and SACtypes 4, 5, 6, 7 and 8 are rural/remote
notes.exclusions: Patients with invalid or missing postal codes were excluded
notes.selection_criteria: Inpatient hospitalizations were selected if the most responsible diagnosis (MRDx) was defined as mental health–related based on a list of ICD-10-CA codes (refer to the Methodology tab)
notes.counting_method: Patients with more than one mental health–related hospitalization were counted once per fiscal year

sources.primary: Discharge Abstract Database and Ontario Mental Health Reporting System, 2018–2019 to 2023–2024, Canadian Institute for Health Information
sources.population_data: Population estimates: Statistics Canada, Demography Division
